Kerri Marusiak

Dog-Lover

Web Developer

Woodworker

Hello!

My name is Kerri, I am a JavaScript web developer based in London. I care a lot about building nice things that work well!

Having formerly trained as a cabinetmaker I worked to create precise, functional furniture. I developed an eye for design, and could fuss over even the smallest details of a project. I like to think that building websites is not so different from building furniture, and I try to employ the ethos of cabinetmaking to building websites.

Skills.

  • JavaScript
  • Angular
  • TypeScript
  • RxJs
  • TypeScript
  • HTML, SCSS
  • Ruby & Ruby on Rails
  • Databases with Postgres & SQL3
  • Git, Jira, Confluence, Notion

Full stack product engineer

React

As a product engineer at zeroheight my role is to develop features,
from planning feature development and thinking about ux/ui, to development in React and Ruby on Rails.

As part of team forest, some of the features I've worked on includes:

  • converting the app's core rich-text editor framework from Quill to the more robust and feature-rich Prosemirror
  • introducing page history versioning and version restoration
  • creating a new editor component type which allows users to monitor and update their components statuses

Early detection dementia testing

Full stack developer
https://cognetivity.com/

July 2021 - Sept 2022 (1 year 3 months)

Angular
Typescript
RxJs
AWS
Jenkins

I was brought on at Cognetivity to assist the lead dev ops engineer in their daily efforts to keep the app running smoothly.

As a healthcare service, it was essential that the app experience no downtime, and that all security updates were conducted within a timely manner. My duties included daily monitoring of the apps using AWS Cloudwatch, performing weekly security checks and updates, and conducting monthly disaster recovery tests.

My secondary role within the company involved rewriting the internal tools app from AngularJS to Angular 13, and implementing new internal tools functionality. This included creating a new role-based system for internal user's access privileges.

Delivering everyday kindness

Front end developer
app.touchnote.com

Aug 2018 - July 2021 (3 years)

Angular
Typescript
RxJs
html
scss

I was hired at TouchNote in 2018, as a front end Angular developer. Here, I was part of the memberships team and developed features for the new membership model that the company adopted shortly after I joined, and also part of the engagement team, which focused on developing feature to keep our existing users active and engaged. Additionally, I took on a variety of more day-to-day tasks such as configuring our regular sales and promotions, maintenance and performance improvements, starting an internal web app wiki to document product flows and logic, and deploying regular and well-documented releases.

Arguably my greatest achievement at TouchNote might be inspiring the new Pet Policy to be written to allow dogs in the office, and the subsequent promotion of my dog Bella to Lead Doggo. She even got her own canvas on the company wall!

Projects.

Recipe Hole

recipe-hole.firebaseapp.com
Ruby on Rails
JavaScript
html
scss
Heroku

Recipe Hole is a personal project which I initially started when I was first learning Angular and Typescript. The app is hosted on Firebase, and uses Firebase's realtime database to store recipe data, as well as Firebase authentication. I put it on the shelf for a couple of years until recently, when my frustration with losing track of my favourite recipes mixed with my dissatisfaction with other recipe sites' data tracking, ads, and long-winded blog posts made me pick this up again.

I added a lot of features, including favouriting and search functionality, user notes and date made functionality, and a funky copy/paste tool for quickly adding ingredients. It has evolved from a basic skills-developing piece into a much more well rounded, and useful app which I do currently use frequently. I'm still adding to it whenever I find some time.

All recipes displayed on login

Notes and date made section

Adding a new recipe

Memoria

hidden-bastion-43962.herokuapp.com (no longer maintained 😢)

Ruby on Rails
JavaScript
html
scss
Heroku

Memoria was my final project I developed for my coding bootcamp. I built the app and the chrome extension myself from scratch, with a rails backend and vanilla javascript frontend, and hosting on Heroku.

I am guilty of always having a million tabs open at once, because I fear that if I close them I will never remember to come back to that page again. Enter Memoria! I built a bookmarking app which takes a screenshot of the page you are viewing to give you that visual memory jog, and saves it as a bookmark to your Memoria homescreen. You can then add tags and edit the entry, as well as sort, search, and filter all entires, in order to find that tab you were looking for.

Memoria homepage displaying bookmarks

Memoria in the extension drawer

Simple alert and bookmark added to homepage
